Title: Quality Management Systems (QMS) Coordinator
Description:
What We Do

Care Access is a unique, multi-specialty network of research sites which operates as one connected team of physician investigators, nurse coordinators, and operations managers. Our goal is to engage every healthcare professional in clinical research and to make clinical trials a care option for every patient. By removing this bottleneck, Care Access is helping accelerate the approval and delivery of critical and life-saving therapies.

Who We Are

We care. Our people are the engines behind our mission: to revolutionize access to clinical trials for the benefit of patients everywhere. We care for one another, find new ideas to accelerate medicine, and seed a long-term impact for generations.

Position Overview

The Quality Management Systems (QMS) Coordinator will be responsible for the effective management and continuous improvement of the QMS within the organization. This role includes ensuring the QMS is up-to-date, performing system administration duties, troubleshooting for staff, and overseeing document control processes. The QMS Coordinator will facilitate communication of document releases and coordinate staff training. A key function of this role will be to also design, build and modify QMS workflows for the QMS modules.

What You'll Be Working On (Duties include but are not limited to):

Key Responsibilities:

QMS Maintenance And Administration

Ensure the QMS is kept up-to-date at all times by driving the update for policies, procedures, and templates as required.Monitor QMS timelines for each QMS module (Documents, Issue Management, CAPA Management). Perform systems administration duties such as user management, troubleshooting system issues, and providing technical support to staff.Regularly monitor the QMS to ensure its effectiveness and compliance with regulatory standards (ISO 9001 and GCP).Design, build and modify QMS workflows for processes controlled by the eQMS. 

Document Control

Manage document control activities supporting with the release of documents within the QMS.Ensure version control of documents, maintaining records of document changes and ensuring outdated versions are appropriately archived.Coordinate the release of new documents into the QMS, ensuring proper approval processes are followed.

Training Coordination

Facilitate communication with staff when new documents or processes are released into the QMS, liaising with the Learning and Development team to ensure training tasks based on role-specific training requirements.Maintain and update the QMS training matrix.Provide support and guidance to staff on QMS-related training requirements.

Reporting And Monitoring

Compile regular reports on the status health and performance of the QMS.Prepare QMS metrics from the QMS for the Operational Compliance Team.

Physical And Travel Requirements

This is a remote position with less than 10% travel requirements. 

What You Bring (Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities)

Extensive experience with electronic Quality Management Systems in a highly regulated environmentExtensive experience of ISO standards and Good Clinical PracticeStrong Communication and project coordination skillsProficient in QMS software platforms and system troubleshootingAttention to detail and strong analytical problem solving skillsAbility to work independently whilst collaborating with cross functional teamsProficient in Microsoft Office Suite 

Certifications/Licenses, Education, And Experience

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience (Life Sciences, Healthcare, or related discipline).

Benefits (US Full-Time Employees Only)

PTO/vacation days, sick days, holidays. 100% paid medical, dental, and vision Insurance. 75% for dependents HSA plan Short-term disability, long-term disability, and life Insurance Culture of growth and equality 401k retirement plan 

Diversity & Inclusion

We serve patients and researchers from diverse cultures and communities around the world. We are stronger and better when we build a team representing the people we aim to support. We maintain an inclusive culture where people from a broad range of backgrounds feel valued and respected as they contribute to our mission. We value diversity and believe that unique contributions drive our success. At Care Access, every day, we are advancing medical breakthroughs. We’re uniting standard patient care with cutting-edge treatments and research. Our work brings life-changing therapies to those in need and paves the way for newer and greater treatments to reach the world. We’re proud to advance these breakthroughs and work with the big players while engaging with the best physicians and caring for patients.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Care Access is unable to sponsor work visas at this time.

Employment Statement

Care Access complies with all employment laws and regulations with respect to its employment practices, terms and conditions of employment, and pay equity and wages. Care Access does not engage in any unfair or forced labor practice and does not tolerate, under any circumstances, the use of any form of forced or involuntary labor, child labor, or human trafficking. This extends to suppliers, partners, or other third parties with whom Care Access does business. Care Access values and promotes the protection of human rights everywhere.
Company Description: Care Access works around the world to make the future of health better for all. We help people learn more about their health, access health resources they need, and participate in research to help find new medicines and cures.
Specialties: rare diseases,pulmonology,oncology,decentralized,decentralized trials,hybrid remote trials,DRO,GI,alzheimers,gastroenterology

Title: Junior Acumatica Consultant
Description:
Job Title: Junior Acumatica Consultant
About Us:A leading provider of ERP solutions, offering end-to-end services that help businesses optimize operations and drive growth. We specialize in delivering cloud-based ERP solutions, with a focus on Acumatica, one of the fastest-growing ERP platforms in the market. We are looking for a motivated Junior Acumatica Consultant to join our dynamic consulting team. This is an exciting opportunity to work with a diverse range of clients, gain hands-on experience with Acumatica, and grow your career in the ERP consulting space.
Position Overview:The Junior Acumatica Consultant will assist in the implementation, customization, and optimization of the Acumatica ERP system for our clients. This is an entry-level consulting role, ideal for candidates with exposure to other ERP systems, who are eager to expand their knowledge in the Acumatica platform. The position will provide on-the-job training and mentorship to help you grow in your consulting career.
Key Responsibilities:
Client Support & Implementation:Assist senior consultants in the implementation of Acumatica for clients, including system setup, configuration, and training. Work with clients to understand their business needs and how Acumatica can meet those needs.ERP Analysis & Documentation:Participate in gathering and analyzing client requirements. Assist in documenting functional specifications, business processes, and system configurations for customizations.Testing & Quality Assurance:Support the testing phase by ensuring that Acumatica configurations are aligned with client requirements. Help troubleshoot any issues and ensure smooth system functionality.Training & User Support:Assist in training end users on how to use Acumatica effectively, providing ongoing support to resolve user issues. Deliver basic training sessions for client teams.Cross-functional Collaboration:Collaborate with technical and functional teams to implement ERP solutions. Provide feedback and assist in troubleshooting, resolving any technical issues that arise during implementation or post-implementation.Continual Learning:Take part in ongoing training and development to enhance your knowledge of Acumatica. Stay up to date with new features and updates in the Acumatica platform.Documentation & Reporting:Help prepare and maintain project documentation, including system configurations, training manuals, and progress reports.
Requirements:
Education:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field (or equivalent work experience).
Experience:ERP Exposure: Previous experience working with any ERP system (e.g., SAP, NetSuite, Microsoft Dynamics, Oracle, Sage, etc.) is highly preferred.Business Process Understanding: Knowledge of business processes such as finance, supply chain, manufacturing, or distribution is a plus.
Technical Skills:Basic knowledge of databases (SQL) or systems integrations is helpful.Familiarity with cloud-based ERP systems is a plus but not required.
Soft Skills:Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with clients and internal teams.Problem-solving ability and the eagerness to learn new systems and technologies.Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Certifications:While not required, any ERP-related certifications (e.g., Acumatica, SAP, Oracle) would be a plus.
Company Description:
Here at Elsdon, we are a next generation team of dynamic professionals who are passionate about helping businesses grow globally within the ever-evolving industries!

We specialize as exceptional talent solutions across a number of sectors including; Technology, Supply Chain and Logistics, Construction, and Energy.

At our agency, we don't believe in the traditional and formal way of doing things. Instead, we approach staffing with a fresh and innovative mindset, always pushing the boundaries to help our clients achieve their goals. We're not afraid to think outside the box and challenge the status quo.
 
Our team is made up of industry experts who have a deep understanding of the complexities and nuances of the supply chain and logistics sector. We take pride in our ability to identify the right talent and match them with the right businesses. Our aim is to build long-lasting relationships with our clients, partnering with them to achieve their business objectives.
 
So, if you're looking for a staffing agency that is cool, exciting, and passionate about driving growth, then look no further. 
Join us on this exciting journey and let's build something great together!

Title: Warehouse Operator/Forklift Operator
Description:
Business Unit Overview

Headquartered in Lakeville, Minn., Post Consumer Brands, a business unit of Post Holdings, Inc., is dedicated to providing people and their pets with delicious food choices for every taste and budget. The company’s portfolio includes beloved brands such as Honey Bunches of Oats®, PEBBLES®, Grape-Nuts® and Malt-O-Meal® cereal, and Peter Pan® peanut butter, as well as Rachael Ray® Nutrish®, Kibbles ‘n Bits® and 9Lives® dog and cat food. As a company committed to high standards of quality and to our values, we are driven by one idea: To make lives better by making delicious food accessible for all. For more information about our brands, visit www.postconsumerbrands.com and follow us on LinkedIn for the latest news.

Brand

Post Consumer Brands recently acquired several iconic pet food brands, venturing into a new market while remaining true to our purpose to provide delicious and accessible food that our consumers love. We’re always searching the center store for the next exciting product to add to our portfolio, and right now, we’re growing and need passionate, driven individuals with diverse perspectives to help us reach greater heights. That’s where you come in. Join a team where your voice is not only heard but valued. Make a real impact on brands enjoyed by millions of people and their pets.

Location Description

Post Consumer Brands is proud to launch an all-new warehouse in Wilmer, TX (15 miles south of Dallas) to efficiently transport pet food, cereal, and all our products to store shelves. This air-conditioned facility will be over 1 million square feet and include all of the latest distribution technology to help deliver on PCB’s core purpose of making lives better by making delicious food accessible for all, including our furry friends!

Responsibilities

Post Consumer Brands is coming to Wilmer, Texas! 

We have a brand new 1.1 M square foot facility that will be opening late summer/early Fall.

Why work at Post Consumer Brands? 

Enjoy a climate-controlled environment; fl exible shift schedules; opportunities for growth; competitive wages; bonus opportunity; generous PTO; health, dental, and vision insurance; and 401(k) match.

Sunday thru Wednesday Nights - 4pm - 2am 

This position is responsible for accurate receiving, storing, picking and loading of product using powered mobile equipment. Expectations include:

Safe operation of powered mobile equipment (forklift/clamp truck)Safe and accurate shipping and receiving of orders to and from our internal and external customersActively participating in team meetings and trainingVerifying location, item and count through a Warehouse Management System.Evaluating quality of products ensuring they are shippable and taking necessary corrective actionOptimizing loads to reduce damage and ensure ease of unloading at destination Accurately completing appropriate documentationAssisting with the sanitation of warehouse, understanding American Institute of Baking (AIB) requirements, and keeping the facility always audit ready


Qualifications

Qualifications:

Ability to drive a forklift following successful completion of forklift certificationWillingness to work a 10-hour shift (AM or PM) which may include weekendsAbility to understand FIFO inventory methods and proceduresAbility to read, write and speak English to understand shipping/receiving documentsBasic math skills Ability to work overtime, if neededAbility to earn a Warehouse Management System certificationHS Diploma or GED required


Physical Requirements

Requires repetitive gripping, pinching, lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling with weight ranges of 0-60 lbs.Repetitive twisting, bending, and reaching of upper and lower extremities.Sustained trunk twistingOccasional climbing and walking activitiesRequires repetitive use of hands and feet bilaterally to operate hand controls and foot pedals on forklift/clamp truck.


Post Holdings provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, status as a covered veteran, and any other category protected under applicable federal, state, provincial, and local laws.
Company Description:
At Post Consumer Brands, we’ve been making breakfast cereal for more than 125 years. It’s what we’re known for best. But today, Post is so much more. From one of the most iconic peanut butter brands to several pet food brands that dogs and cats love, we’re laser-focused on the center store and growing our portfolio of shelf-stable foods that families rely on. We're looking for motivated people from all walks of life who share our purpose to make lives better by making delicious food more accessible. 

Join our journey to deliver delicious and bring your ideas and passion because here at Post, every employee is vital to our success. 

Sounds like it might be a match? Check out what Post Consumer Brands can mean for your future.

Title: Specialist, Ingredient Planner
Description:
ABOUT USAt the heart of AG1 lies a commitment to our mission to empower people to take ownership of their health. Since 2010, we've dedicated ourselves to bringing Foundational Nutrition to people around the world.Our ethos is deeply rooted in science, with an unwavering dedication to continuous improvement. We leverage and contribute to the latest research to deliver a powerful, straightforward solution for optimal health to our customers. We harness the finest ingredients so that every scoop of AG1 gives you the nutrients you need with the simplicity you want in a daily routine.Likewise, our organization puts the same energy into creating an environment that is a reflection of the cultural values that define who we are and how we work together. These seven values— One Spectacular Life, Customer Centric, Radical Ownership, High Performance, Courage, Good Humans and Continuous Improvement—are a representation of the high standards we set, and hold ourselves accountable to, when it comes to building our global team.
THE ROLEWe are looking for a detailed-oriented, highly analytical and skilled Specialist, Ingredient Planner to join our growing global Supply Chain team. This role plays a crucial part in ensuring the efficient flow of ingredients and raw materials throughout the manufacturing process for all AG1 products. This position is responsible for forecasting ingredient needs, coordinating with suppliers and co-manufacturers, maintaining inventory levels, and ensuring that production has the necessary resources to meet customer demand. This role works closely with procurement, manufacturing, and external suppliers to optimize supply chain operations and avoid material shortages or excess inventory.
Reporting to the Sr Director, Planning & Inventory Management, this position will drive accountability with our co-manufacturers and suppliers to ensure optimal inventory levels throughout the supply chain. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and interpersonal skills with a background in forecasting, supply chain planning, and cross-functional collaboration. As this position supports our fast-paced global supply chain initiatives, you must be solution oriented, collaborative and resourceful in shaping recommendations that will better position our ingredient supply, and set our business up for success as we grow and scale.
WHAT YOU’LL DOIngredient PlanningDevelop and maintain accurate ingredient forecasts based on production schedules across multiple co-manufacturers globally, purchase orders, and ingredient inventory on hand.Create and manage Material Requirements Planning (MRP) reports to determine material needs and inventory requirements.Plan for and manage material supply to meet production goals while minimizing stockouts and overstock situations.Participate in the S&OP process by providing insights on ingredient inventory to support forecasted demandInventory Management:Monitor inventory levels at our co-manufacturers and identify gaps or risks to ensure adequate supply without excessive surplus.Work with the co-manufacturers to ensure accurate inventory records.Support ingredient replenishment and confirm safety stock levels as needed.Supplier Coordination:Collaborate with procurement and purchasing teams to ensure timely delivery of materials.Maintain strong relationships with suppliers, evaluating lead times and ensuring quality standards are met.Address any supply chain disruptions, delays, or issues to maintain smooth production.Manufacturing Support:Provide manufacturing teams with material availability updates and ensure ingredients are ready for use in production processes.Work closely with production schedules to align material deliveries with production timelines.Address material shortages or overages and resolve discrepancies in collaboration with internal teams.Data Analysis and Reporting:Analyze ingredient usage, forecast accuracy, and lead times to improve planning accuracy.Prepare reports and key performance indicators (KPIs) on ingredient availability, inventory levels, and supplier performance.Identify process improvements and recommend solutions to enhance ingredient flow efficiency.
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR3-5 years of professional experience in material planning, inventory management, or supply chain roles in a manufacturing or production environmentBachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Business, Industrial Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).Proficiency in MRP/ERP systems (Netsuite experience is preferred, or SAP, Oracle, or other relevant software).Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data for decision-making.Excellent organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills.Ability to work cross-functionally with procurement, manufacturing, and logistics teams.Knowledge of lean manufacturing, supply chain optimization, and inventory management best practices.Attention to detail and accuracy in forecasting and planning.Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills.Proactive and self-motivated with a focus on continuous improvement.You have a no-compromises approach to the quality of your work and are a team player.Comfortable working in a remote setting. Preference for candidates based in Eastern Standard Time (EST) to ensure sufficient overlap with our European team.You are knowledgeable in all things MS Office and Google Suite.Experience with consumer products in e-commerce, direct-to-consumer and/or CPG a plus.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?Competitive compensation and performance-based incentive plans.A 100% remote working environment (excluding Laboratory positions), which has been implemented from day one.A strong company culture that is enforced through the hiring process to ensure values alignment and a highly collaborative team.A mission-driven approach to everything that we do, with an overall goal to significantly improve our customers’ health and wellness.A high-growth, dynamic environment with opportunities for your direct impact to be felt.Paid holidays, company-wide mental health days, and unlimited PTO (based on your country of residence).In-person team meetups for optimal collaboration, team building and accelerating productivity.A work environment and culture that is based on high performance, productivity and continuous improvement.The opportunity to work with passionate, high-growth, business-minded colleagues who bring their all to our mission each and every day.Access to AG1 products and branded swag.Monthly telecom stipend to offset some of the costs of home internet/wifi for eligible team members.All other benefits and insurances as required by law, based on your specific country of residence.
AG1 is dedicated to providing equitable and competitive compensation & benefits packages. For this particular role, the base salary range is $69,000.00 - $86,500.00 and will ultimately be decided at the offer stage, based on an individual candidate’s level of skills and experience aligned with the needs of this role. Base salary is one component of total compensation for this position. We provide a competitive mix of base salary, performance bonus, and stock option allocation for eligible roles.AG1 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to inspiring fulfilling lives, starting with a focus on health and we believe this starts in the workplace. We do this by providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where all team members can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and make a difference in the world together. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, pregnancy, veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by law. We are an equal opportunity employer.
Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
Company Description:
At the heart of AG1 (Athletic Greens) lies a commitment to our mission, to empower people to take ownership of their health. Since 2010, we've dedicated ourselves to enhancing our formula to bring Foundational Nutrition to people around the world.

Our approach is deeply rooted in science, with a continuous pursuit of excellence. We leverage and contribute to the latest research to deliver a powerful, straightforward solution for optimal health to our customers. Title: Supplier Process Engineer
Description:
At Beehive Industries, we believe there is a better way to meet our clients' needs. Through Additive Manufacturing, Beehive Industries helps clients achieve more than what has ever been thought possible. We are seeking a Supplier Process Engineer, that will be responsible optimizing manufacturing processes to ensure high-quality components and materials and assess capacity and capability of the supply base to support long term customer demand. This role will be a remote role, with travel to visit vendors.

Key Responsibilities

Supplier Process Optimization:

 Collaborate with suppliers to improve production processes, reduce waste, and enhance efficiency. Identify areas for process improvement, cost reduction, and quality enhancement at supplier facilities. Implement Lean and Six Sigma principles to optimize production lines and reduce operational costs.

Supplier Development

 Provide technical support and training to suppliers to enhance their production capabilities. Work with suppliers to introduce new technologies or processes that improve quality and productivity. Assist in the qualification of new suppliers and monitor supplier performance through key performance indicators (KPIs).

New Product Introduction (NPI)

 Work with cross-functional teams to introduce new products to suppliers, ensuring a smooth transition from design to production. Support suppliers in the validation and ramp-up phases for new products.

Problem-Solving And Troubleshooting

 Address and resolve technical production issues at suppliers' facilities. Investigate and troubleshoot process failures, equipment malfunctions, and production delays. Work with suppliers to implement corrective and preventive actions to eliminate recurring issues.

Collaboration And Communication

 Act as the main point of contact between internal teams and external suppliers for process-related matters. Provide regular updates on supplier performance, process improvements, and project progress to management. Collaborate with the purchasing and quality teams to resolve issues related to material availability, lead times, and supplier performance.

Continuous Improvement

 Identify and promote continuous improvement initiatives both internally and at supplier facilities. Participate in cross-functional teams to implement best practices, process enhancements, and innovative solutions.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in engineering (Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial, or Manufacturing)7-10 years of experience in process engineering or manufacturing engineering, preferably with experience in supplier management or supply chain operations.Experience in Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma, or similar process improvement methodologies.Hands-on experience with process optimization, root cause analysis, and quality control.Ability to travel to supplier locations as needed.

Preferred Qualifications

Strong problem-solving, analytical, and troubleshooting abilities.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for working with both internal teams and suppliers.Knowledge of quality management systems and familiarity with Department of Defense regulatory requirements.Proficiency in data analysis tools and process simulation software.

If this sounds like you, please submit an application with your resume. This could be the opportunity you are looking for to expand your skills, contribute to a winning team, and work with talented people who love what they do and take pride in our mission.

Beehive Industries offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes group Medical, Dental, Life, and Short and Long-Term disability coverage from day one. We also offer a generous 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with a Company match. Every role at Beehive Industries is bonus eligible, and will also receive equity in the company.

Beehive Industries is committed to full compliance with applicable anti-discrimination laws. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We strive to create an inclusive work environment and will not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Company Description:
Beehive Industries is an American manufacturer, technology developer, and innovation partner for defense, aerospace, and related industries. We design, develop, and manufacture industry-defining innovations in the USA, with the ultimate goal of reindustrializing America.

For more information, visit beehive-industries.com.
Specialties: Additive Manufacturing,3D Printing,AM Manufacturing,Metal Printing,Manufacturing,Propulsion,Aerospace

Title: Shipping - Shipper II
Description:
Klein Tools is a dynamic, fast-paced and results driven company dedicated to launching hundreds of innovative products each year. Are you ready to make an impact?

Perks for you include:

 Paid Vacations & Holidays Profit Sharing & Matching 401(k) Health Insurance (Medical, Vision, & Dental) Discounts on Klein Tools products Education and Professional Development Assistance

The Shipping Clerk II works under close supervision of the Shipping Supervisor to prepare packages for shipment by packaging boxes and staging pallets according to the daily shipping schedule and delivery specifications and assisting with loading and unloading trucks as needed.

 Sort and stage pallets in the shipping dock by operating a Pallet Jack or by hand based on daily shipping schedule, truck weight limits and requirements.  Prepare packages for shipping by taping or stapling boxes shut and affixing completed address label.  Generate air pillows at the shipping line by entering quantity and size needed in the Air Pillow Machine and placing them in boxes.  Investigate packages that are flagged as not meeting the specified weight requirements on the shipping conveyor line and make necessary adjustments or escalate issues to the Shipping Supervisor.  Wrap ready-to-ship pallets by operating the shrink wrap machine to ensure the product on the pallet does not shift during transport before it is loaded on the truck for shipment.  Scan products for delivery by operating RF Scanner to scan bar code of packages and enter delivery information.  Assemble specialized boxes for custom orders using a Staple Gun.  Note any order discrepancies and damages to inform Shipping Supervisor.  May load product on trucks by operating a Forklift or Pallet Jack.  Perform daily safety inspections of material handling equipment.  Observe all safety guidelines and report safety concerns to management.  Follow Six Sigma lean manufacturing standards to keep work area clean and safe from hazards.  Perform other duties as assigned. 

Qualifications

 One year of relevant work experience required. High School Diploma/GED and experience working in a distribution or manufacturing environment preferred. Must be able to read, write, speak and understand basic English. Must possess knowledge in updating data and navigating through warehouse management systems. Experience with IMI Series (AS400) and Boss is preferred.  Must be able to operate a Class II Order Picker and Class II Stand-Up Forklift, Pallet Jack, Label Printing System, RF Scanner, and Staple Gun. Ability to demonstrate basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division). Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment. Ability to work independently and with others. Ability to meet established deadlines. Ability to demonstrate strong attention to detail. 

 Physical Demand Requirements

Regularly required to stand, walk, bend, and lift; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; The employee is occasionally required to sit, reach above shoulders, climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; taste or smell. The employee must lift and/or move objects up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

DISCLAIMER: This position may include exposure to radio frequencies that may be dangerous to individuals with a pacemaker, consult with your doctor.

Your main focus:

 Quality Customer Obsession Innovation Ownership Teamwork

Klein Tools is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. For candidates with disabilities and needing assistance, please email us at hr@kleintools.com.

Apply Now
Company Description:
At Klein Tools, our dedication to quality and a customer-centric approach has established us as a leader for trade professionals seeking cutting-edge products and solutions they need to reach new heights of performance and safety. 

With a history dating back to 1857, we continue to be a dynamic and innovative powerhouse. Our values are the cornerstone of our company's culture, setting us apart from others in the industry and paving the way for our continued growth. Quality, Customer Obsession, Innovation, Teamwork, and Ownership make up the core of Klein Tools. Our dedicated teams are the driving force behind our continued success. Their passion fuels our growth, creating opportunities for talented individuals to become part of our expanding teams. 
 
We empower you with the resources you need to shape your future and help redefine industry standards. If you're looking for an environment powered by innovation where rapid growth is constant, Klein Tools is where you belong.

Title: Senior Manager, Supply Chain - Pharmaceutical Distribution & Logistics
Description:
Job Description Summary

The Senior Manager, Supply Chain – Pharmaceutical Distribution & Logistics leads the market launch readiness and expansion planning with distribution partners and transport providers, manages existing distribution of Commercial product, clinical trials, and research and development materials of temperature-controlled products in compliance with internal procedures, global import and export requirements, DOT /IATA regulations, GxP requirements across PTC regions.

The incumbent leads projects and collaborates with PTC internal departments and third-party vendors (including, but not limited to, Contract Manufacturing Organizations (CMOs), Contract Distribution Organizations (CDOs) shipping agents, and customs brokers to ensure the availability of Commercial Product, research and development materials, and clinical shipments with the US and internationally.

The Senior Manager, Supply Chain – Distribution & Logistics supports adherence to relevant regulatory requirements, and company Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) as appropriate.

Job Description

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Primary Duties/responsibilities

Leads US Supply Chain readiness and set up across the PTC distribution network for new product launches and supports expansion to new territories.Leads the assessment & introduction of new 3PL’s/transport providers across US Supply Chain, to include the RFP process, assessment of vendors, approvals, contract negotiation and onboarding.Interface with Supply Chain Technical Operations launch team to coordinate distribution setup activities relating to new product introductionsLeads and coordinates shipping activities across CMC stakeholders, external logistics providers, PTC supply chain partners, customs brokers and related parties of samples, API’s, raw materials, intermediates, semi-finished and finished goods for development, pre-clinical, clinical, and commercial use to and from domestic and international locationsDevelops strong relationships with cross functional stakeholders across the supply chainManages the supply and distribution of existing commercial products from the primary distribution centre to pharmacies, hospitals, wholesalers, and customers internationally; interacts with these customers to monitor supply operations and to troubleshoot when required.Interacts with CMOs, manages relationships with CDOs and transport providers to ensure the timely shipping and delivery of inventory; coordinates and implements the logistics activities associated with the international and domestic transportation and distribution of PTC’s products.Facilitates and supports routing order management including general support for all orders processed in pre-defined markets and supports local regions in relation to customer approval, orders and general enquiries.Ensures documentation relating to customs clearance and supply authorizations is obtained for all orders and that no delay is incurred due to inaccurate documentation.Leads the new customer approval process including coordinating the onboarding of new distribution partners and pharmacies as per internal procedures.Creates documentation to supply order management and supply chain processes. Manages logistics flow and transport to work in progress (WIP) and finished products.Supports supplier management of PTC distribution centres including, but not limited to, management of queries, support of all orders (including approval of orders), set-up and approval of new customers and measuring of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to drive performance for on-time and full-delivery performance.Manages the documentation of quality issues related to supply chain procedures, including but not limited to risk; Risk Assessments, Change Controls, Deviations, CAPAs and SOPs.Prepares and / or reviews shipping documentation ensuring accuracy and compliance with customs requirements and trade regulations for domestic and international shipments. This includes commercial invoice, USDA memo, FDA memo, End Use Letters, statements required by other regulatory agencies, and other documentation as may be required.Manages the internal data repositories for shipping documentation and related information in a compliant manner.Develops and delivers periodic training for internal stakeholders in shipping processes to minimize errors. Routinely updates training materials to ensure continuous improvement.Interacts with transport providers to resolve issues and clear bottlenecks to ensure the timely delivery of PTC products and materials for domestic and international shipments.Supports logistic activities related to new product launches and special shipments by writing transportation protocols to qualify product transport and shipping lanes.Performs other tasks and assignments as needed and specified by management. 

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities Required

 Minimum level of education and years of relevant work experience.Bachelor’s degree or higher in engineering or a related technical discipline and a minimum of 7 years of supply chain, logistical or manufacturing experience in a pharmaceutical, biotechnology, or related environment. Special knowledge or skills needed and/or licenses or certificates required.Demonstrated ability to set up GDP Distribution requirements for market/region set up/expansionStrong relationship management with internal team and members and external vendors. Ability to manage and lead projects with a high degree of complexityStrong working knowledge in Good Distribution Practice (GDP) in the pharmaceutical industry or related field, HTS classifications, U.S. import and export regulations, Hazmat shipping requirements, DOT / IATA requirements, Safety Data Sheets.Proficiency with Microsoft Office.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Ability to work independently and collaboratively, as required, in a fast-paced, matrixed, team environment consisting of internal and external team members.Analytical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines. Excellent planning, organization and time management skills including the ability to support and prioritize multiple projects. Special knowledge or skills and/or licenses or certificates preferred.Working knowledge of import and export requirements and trade compliance requirements in major geographies including US, Asia, Latin America, and European Union.PMP a plus Travel requirementsUp to 10%

Expected Base Salary Range: $130,700 - $150,000. The base salary offered will be contingent on assessment of candidate education level, background, and experience relative to the requirements of the position they are being considered for, as well as review of internal equity. In addition to base salary, PTC employees are also eligible for short- and long-term incentives. All eligible employees may also enroll in PTC’s medical, dental, vision, and retirement savings plans.

EEO Statement

PTC Therapeutics is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all individuals, regardless of race, color, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, disability, veteran status or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

Title: Warehouse Associate
Description:
Future Metals LLC

Title: Supply Chain Manager, Raw Materials
Description:
Why Choose Us?

Novolex® is a leader in packaging innovation, choice and sustainability. We manufacture products in paper, plastic and sustainable materials for the food, retail, health and industrial markets.

$80,000 - $100,000* base salary + annual bonusWellness rewards to fund your HRA or HSAPaid holidays, time off, parental and other leavesFinancial protection benefits such as life, AD&D and disability insurance, and 401(k) Plan with employer matching contributionsEducation Support (for example, tuition reimbursement, Chairman’s Scholarship, 529 College Savings Plan)Broad Based Employee Award Program—value sharing plan for all employees with one year of serviceEmployee Assistance Program and much more!The range provided is based on cost of living/geography and what we believe is reasonable in the market at the time of posting. This role may be eligible for annual bonus and annual merit increase, as well as long term compensation. Some roles may also be eligible for overtime pay, in accordance with federal and state requirements. Actual base salary pay will be based on a number of factors, including skills, competencies, experience, and other job-related factors.


Our Sustainability Commitment

The Novolex sustainability vision is built upon three pillars: our products, our operations and our people. Each is critically important to our growth and future as a business. These pillars form the foundation of our company-wide commitment to sustainability, helping us achieve our ambitious goals through our wide-ranging initiatives.

How You'll Perform The Role

This position is responsible for ensuring that strategic material planning processes are in place to enable operational and production continuity. They will contribute to the creation and implementation of best practices, company vision, strategy, policies, processes and procedures to aid and improve raw material planning performance. Takes a coordinating lead, working closely with internal and external parties to ensure supply of materials are in place to satisfy production requirements. Able to deliver efficient, effective and flexible solutions to meet production requirements. This role holds people and budgetary management responsibilities for working capital management for assigned business units.

Manage, coach and develop a high performing team that meets agreed objectives which delivers best practice results, added value and continuous improvements.Ensure that material scheduling strategies and processes are in place and work effectively to ensure. material supply meets production requirements with minimum stock levels, while optimizing cost.Take ownership of material planning issues that arise, including over or under delivery and take any follow up actions especially in the event of material shortages that affect productionWork closely with the sourcing team to ensure sourcing strategies are optimized.Assess volume requirements against planning assumptions.Manage inventory risk and ensure that contingency plans are in place.Seek and recommend solutions to overcome issues arising in order to meet production requirements and address operational risks.Ensure that any Material Requirements Planning system or IT system in place is effective and that data is accurate and up to date and resolve any issues as required.Investigate and implement system enhancement initiatives.Resolves discrepancies and issues in invoices and purchase orders.Responsible for communication between operations, sales, customer service, quoting and suppliers to ensure that adequate raw material is received, and proper information is obtained.Manage multiple tasks with varying timelines/priorities in a fast-paced environment.Supplier ownership/relationship management.Complete month end activities to support cash flow forecasting and working capital management.Support/lead cross functional improvement projects driving increased profitability.Support New Product Introduction trials and item master data set-ups.


What We Need From You

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent Work experience, required5+ years of relevant experience in purchasing, planning, and supplier managementProven management skills with the ability to optimize team performance and development Excellent communication, leadership, project management and relationship building skillsStrong analytical, business process analysis and problem-solving capabilitiesBe highly “process driven” and continuously improve the supply chain buying/planning.Strong organizational skills with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.High motivation and results-oriented work ethicAdaptability-able to work in a fast-paced environment.Willing to travel as needed (less than 25%)Proficiency in analytical tools and databases, including MS Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Project, and ERP systems including Microsoft AX, BAAN, PRMS, SAP, Rapid Response


What You'll Get From Us

Benefits

With safety as our top priority and a commitment to employee well-being an important focus, we offer comprehensive and competitive benefits that include medical, dental and vision insurance (including Telehealth options) as well as a variety of other well-being resources focused on mental, physical and financial health. Specific benefits and well-being programs may vary depending on where you work.

At Novolex, giving back to the local communities that support us is important. Our Focused Giving Program prioritizes support for organizations whose missions promote sustainability initiatives or address food and hunger needs. We also encourage facility level support of activities in the communities where our employees live and work.

Training and Development

We offer constant opportunities for advancement. From skills development to advanced education programs, training and development programs and courses are available through Novolex University. Programs include company and industry training curricula, support for formal education through the Tuition Reimbursement Program, and a Learning Management System that supports and enhances employee skills at all levels of the organization.

Title: Production Supervisor
Description:
Job Details

Level

Experienced

Job Location

BLU Coppell Plant - Coppell, TX

Position Type

Full Time

Education Level

Bachelors Degree

Travel Percentage

None

Job Category

Manufacturing

Description

We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Production Supervisor for our 3rd shift operations. This position oversees production lines in the manufacturing Plant under the supervision of the Production Manager and Director of Manufacturing to ensure product quality and delivery to distribution. It is responsible for directly supervising production associates and working closely with all other departments in the manufacturing plant, including maintenance, sanitation, raw materials, and shipping. This role requires strong leadership skills, a commitment to operational excellence, and the ability to problem-solve in as fast-paced environment.

Duties And Responsibilities

 Responsible for ensuring and maintaining a safe work environment through compliance with Company, Local, State, and Federal mandates or programs; enforce safety protocols and procedures to create a safe working environment for all employees; conduct safety training sessions and investigations into any accidents or incidents.  Demonstrates support for Food Safety, Food Defense Initiatives, and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and ensures adherence to all quality requirements, including Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCPs), Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), etc.  Monitors product quality: Ensures products meet quality standards by conducting regular inspections, implementing quality control measures, and addressing deviations from specifications.  Provide leadership, training, and coaching with associates to create a culture of inclusion and engagement.  Accomplishes manufacturing staff results by communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results; coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees; initiating, coordinating, and enforcing systems, policies, and procedures.  Executes and maintains records for all production phases relative to safety, food safety, key performance indicators, and order completion.  Maintains workflow by monitoring process steps, setting processing variables, observing control points and equipment, monitoring personnel and resources, studying methods, implementing cost reductions, developing reporting procedures and systems, facilitating corrections to malfunctions within process control points, and initiating and fostering a spirit of cooperation within and between departments.  Responsible for obtaining positive results on production indicators such as efficiency, efficacy, labor efficiency, waste, and production downtime.  Ensures equipment operation by calling for repairs and evaluating new equipment and techniques.  LEAN manufacturing culture: Create a Continuous Improvement environment by improving products and processes with the objective of reducing waste while striving for efficiency and profitability.  Maintains a safe and clean work environment by following 5’s program. Directs personnel on the use of all control points, equipment, and resources, maintaining compliance with established policies and procedures. 

Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (such as industrial engineering, manufacturing, or business administration) or equivalent work experience  Previous experience in a supervisory role within a manufacturing environment for third shift  Strong leadership and communication skills  Knowledge of manufacturing processes and equipment  Familiarity with quality management systems and lean manufacturing principles.  Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.  Proficiency in computer applications such as Microsoft Office and manufacturing software systems.  HACCP Training 

Leadership Skills

 High level of Integrity  Meticulous attention to organized detail  Good analytical thinking skills  Good verbal and written communication skills  Good knowledge of the implementation of policies & procedures  Good planning, organizing, and integration skills  Bi-lingual preferred but not required. 

Barcel USA LLC is an equal opportunity employer with a policy that provides equal employment opportunity for applicants and employees regardless of race, color, religion, disability, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, reassignment, layoff, discharge, education, training, and all other working conditions.
Company Description: Barcel USA is the snack division of Grupo Bimbo located in the United States. We are an exciting, young and fast-growing consumer packaged goods company headquartered in Coppell, Texas with a strong presence in the largest markets within United States territory. We manufacture, distribute and sell a great selection of snacks, offering a mix of unique, sweet and spicy products elaborated with the highest quality standards.

Title: Quality Engineer
Description:
Lasko Products, an industry leader in providing and manufacturing home environment products for over 100 years, is looking to add a Quality Engineer to the team. This role will be based out of our Ft. Worth, TX location.

The Lasko Quality Engineer's responsibilities include developing and documenting quality standards, inspecting incoming materials, auditing and inspecting processes and products, developing quality control systems, and determining corrective actions.

Job Responsibilities

Duties will include management of change control, data collection schemes, developing testing metrologies, overseeing test methods & equipment, creating standard work and job instructions, audits and other routine quality systems areas.Direct the activities of quality staff and audit team members in the Quality Manager’s absence. Other duties include training plant personnel in quality processes; facilitating improvement teams and managing compliance to specifications.Work directly with the local Quality Manager, the Corporate Quality Director, and plant management to define and implement quality objectives including KPI’s that align with corporate and plant initiatives.Directly manage the daily activities of several Quality employees.Interpret Engineering specifications into Quality requirements on the plant floor.Manage supplier quality through incoming inspection and interaction with suppliers on quality issues, occasionally may require visits to suppliers.Lead and organize formal/informal problem solving in areas of scrap, process capability, warranty, etc. Provide training in quality systems and related areas such as APQP, BOS, Problem Solving, Statistical Process Control, Gage R&R, Process Capability, and DOE.Work with the manufacturing department to implement quality requirements in assembly and component manufacturing.Drive projects to reduce COPQ per company’s goals.Manage the testing and auditing of components and finished products.Implement nonconforming material processes and lead Material Review Board (MRB) meetings.Partner with Engineering and Manufacturing early in the design stage in order to build quality into the product design and manufacturing process. Participate in failure mode effects analysis (FMEA) as required.Track quality issues and trends, report information to plant management and Corporate Quality.Coordinate daily inspection and testing of components and products.Implement customer specific quality requirements in the manufacturing of components and products.Assist Lasko customer service to investigate customer quality issues and drive corrective actions.Interact with customers to solve field Quality issues.

Competencies And Abilities

Experience, expertise, and implementation of Quality Management Systems, specifically ISO 9001 2015.Experience with PPAP, APQP, FMEA, and structured problems solving tools such as 8D, PDCA, or DMAIC.Practical knowledge of statistical tools and variance reductionExperience with COPQ reductionProject Management skillsStrong ability to develop talent

Certifications And Special Requirements

Six Sigma Green Belt required. Blackbelt is a plus.Lean Systems training desired.Proficiency is using Minitab and Visio.Spanish is a plus.

Required Education And Experience

Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Engineering (Industrial or Mechanical), or Engineering Technology3-5 Years of experience in quality engineering area of a manufacturing facilityPlastic Injection molding experience desiredAssembly line experience desired

About The Company

Lasko Metal Products was founded in 1906 by Henry Lasko in Philadelphia. Lasko designs, manufactures, assembles, and distributes portable fans, heaters, and humidifiers for the consumer market (Lasko brand), air purifiers (Germ Guardian brand), ventilation products such as range hoods and bathroom exhaust fans to the construction industry (Air King brand) and water damage restoration products such as air scrubbers and dehumidifiers (B-Air brand). Lasko’s products are sold in North America, South America, the Caribbean, and Asia. The company is recognized as the leader in the portable fan and portable heating categories and proudly operates American manufacturing, assembly, and distribution facilities across the US. Lasko’s leading market share in fans and heaters is 2X – 4X larger than the #2 brand. Lasko’s domestic production capabilities uniquely position Lasko to serve its customers.

Lasko’s Mission Is To Improve Everyday Life With Trusted Products Which Create a Healthier And More Comfortable Environment. The Company’s Success Is Based On 5 Core Values

Be Bold:Challenge the status quoCourageously pursue the impossible Reject mediocrityBe Together Work together for success Drive trust and candor with each other Prioritize "We" before "I" Be A LeaderLead with personal conviction Inspire each other to deliver high- quality resultsLeverage resilience and agility to drive excellenceBe Accountable Consistently deliver to our customers Embrace commitments as a contract Take pride in our actionsBe The Change Demonstrate a passion to win Make a difference at work in our communities Step forward and take initiative
The Lasko family owned and operated Lasko Products until November 2016, when private investment firms Comvest Partners and JW Levin Management Partners (“JWLMP”) acquired the business. Comvest Partners and JWLMP are committed to growing the business with investments in growth and productivity.

Geographic Reach

Based in the greater Philadelphia, PA area, Lasko Products operates in locations throughout the US and Canada. The company’s Tennessee, Texas, and Pennsylvania manufacturing facilities produce both indoor and outdoor fans and heaters. The company also sources select products internationally from China, Taiwan, Vietnam, Malaysia, and India. Lasko operates distribution centers in all manufacturing locations plus Nevada and Ohio.

Diversity & Inclusion

Comvest and its portfolio companies recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote regardless of race/national origin, gender/gender identification, sexual orientation, age, disability status, veteran status, religious affiliation, and other protected status. We have a clear vision to be the place where diverse talent wants to come, stay, and do their best work. We know our companies run on the hard work and dedication of our passionate and smart employees. We believe that diversity within an organization creates long-term value for the organization itself and its constituents. Comvest and its portfolio companies are high performing organizations that seeks to hire hard-working and dedicated high performers. While Comvest and its portfolio companies always strive to look at a diverse pool of candidates, we will always choose the most qualified candidate for the job being recruited for, in order to strive for success for both the employee and the firm.
Company Description:
Lasko's mission is to improve everyday life with trusted products which create a healthier and more comfortable environment.

Lasko’s FIve Core Values include Be Bold, Be Together, Be A Leader, Be Accountable, Be The Change.
     •	Be Bold – Challenge the status quo, Courageously pursue the impossible, 
        Reject mediocrity
     •	Be Together – Work together for success, Drive trust and candor with each 
        other, Prioritize “We” before “I”
     •	Be A Leader - Lead with personal conviction, Inspire each other to deliver 
        high-quality results, Leverage resilience and agility to drive excellence
     •	Be Accountable – Consistently deliver to our customers, Embrace 
        commitments as a contract, Take pride in our actions
     •	Be The Change - Demonstrate a passion to win, Make a difference at work 
        and in our communities, Step forward and take initiative

Lasko has been engineering and building high-performance home comfort products in the U.S. and worldwide for more than 100 years. This American company has grown to an international organization and market leader in fans, ceramic heaters, and other home comfort products.

With domestic resources to service the market in season, Lasko collaborates with its accounts to maximize sales. Plus, the hallmarks of the product line – performance, quality, and value – make Lasko a consumer favorite.

The full product line of innovative portable fans, portable heaters, and humidifiers can be viewed at www.lasko.com.
Specialties: Home Comfort Solutions - Fans / Heaters / Humidifiers / Air Purifiers,USA and Global Manufacturing,Value-Driven Performance Products,Flexible and Responsive Account Services

Title: Manager Quality Engineering Mobile Apps
Description:
This role is based at one of our corporate offices in Memphis, TN, or Dallas, TX***

This is your chance to be a part of an in-house Technology team that’s creating consumer-facing, cutting-edge technologies revolutionizing the hospitality industry around the world! As a Manager Quality Engineering you will bring your technical and testing skills to a hospitality company with an award-winning culture. On the Quality Engineering team reporting to Director of Quality Engineering you will support the Hilton Honors and other Hilton software applications.

How We Will Support You

Hilton is proud to support the mental and physical wellbeing of all Team Members so they can Thrive personally and professionally in a diverse and inclusive environment, thanks to programs and benefits such as:

Go Hilton travel program: 100 nights of discounted travel with room rates as low as $40/nightHilton Shares: Our employee stock purchase program (ESPP) - you can purchase Hilton shares at a 15 percent discountPaid parental leave for eligible Team Members, including partners and adoptive parentsMental health resources including free counseling through our Employee Assistance ProgramPaid Time Off (PTO)Learn more about the rest of our benefits

At Hilton, we believe every Team Member is a leader. We are committed to offering leadership development opportunities and programs through every step of a Team Member’s career journey and at every level, both in our hotels and across corporate.

Available benefits may vary depending upon terms and conditions of employment and are subject to the terms and conditions of the plans.

How You Will Make An Impact

Your role is important and below are some of the fundamental job duties that make your work unique.

What Your Day-to-day Will Be Like

Manage a team of QA engineers, providing regular performance feedback, evaluation, and coaching.Use data from quality metrics to provide insights into product quality and identify areas for improvement. Use these insights to lead actionable changes that enhance overall product quality.Prioritize, plan, and negotiate conflicts or challenges.Identify gaps and ideas for continuous improvement of processes.

How You Will Collaborate With Others

Collaborate with others to gain an understanding of application architecture, risks, and quality needs while providing leadership to your assigned team.Collaborate with product and engineering teams to prioritize test plans and test execution, ensure comprehensive test coverage, and provide quality metrics.Partner with QE Managers, Development, and DevOps teams to improve processes and procedures.

What Deliverables You Will Take Ownership Of

QA, UAT, automation and/or Post-Release testing of our mobile apps.Quality metrics reporting.Assigned deliverables utilizing a variety of technologies.

WHY YOU'LL BE A GREAT FIT

You Have These Minimum Qualifications

Five (5) years of professional work experience in Technology or related fieldTwo (2) years of management experience in a Technical roleHands-on experience with product release testingTravel up to 15%

It Would Be Useful If You Have

Bachelor’s Degree, or Associate’s Degree plus 6+ years of Technology related experience, or High School Degree/GED plus 12+ years of Technology related experience Seven (7) + years of professional work experience in Technology or a related fieldFive (5) + years of professional experience with automated testing; and Agile MethodologiesExperience testing digital wallets, digital payment services, and contactless paymentsExposure to large-scale enterprise software products

What It Is Like Working For Hilton

Hilton, the #1 World's Best Workplace, is a leading global hospitality company with a diverse portfolio of world-class brands. Dedicated to filling the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality, we have welcomed more than 3 billion guests in our more-than 100-year history. Hilton is proud to have an award-winning workplace culture and we are consistently named among one of the World’s Best Workplaces. Check out the Hilton Careers blog and Instagram to learn more about what it’s like to be on Team Hilton!

It is the policy of Hilton to employ qualified persons without regard to color, race, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medication conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, military service, status as a protected veteran, disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable law, genetic information, or any other protected group status as defined by and subject to applicable federal, state and local laws.

We provide reasonable accommodations to qualified persons with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position and provide other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. Please contact us if you require an accommodation during the application process.

Dedicated to fulfilling its founding vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality, Hilton has welcomed over 3 billion guests in its more than 100-year history, was named the No. 1 World’s Best Workplace by Great Place to Work and Fortune and has been recognized as a global leader on the Dow Jones Sustainability Indices for seven consecutive years. Company Description:
As the global leader of premium labels, MCC helps brands stand out in competitive markets and inspire positive consumer experiences. With a network of 12,000+ teammates and facilities across 25+ countries and six continents, we combine global reach with the personalized touch of local service. 

Our experienced team is here to assist you with an array of label solutions and diverse market expertise. By combining a collaborative approach and a wide range of value-added services, MCC aims to be your label partner from concept to commercialization. 

Backed by over a century of printing experience, MCC is focused on the future by developing consumer-driven innovations and sustainable packaging solutions.
