Title: Engineer II, Mechanical
Description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

Working at Abbott

At Abbott, You Can Do Work That Matters, Grow, And Learn, Care For Yourself And Your Family, Be Your True Self, And Live a Full Life. You’ll Also Have Access To

Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.Employees can qualify for free medical coverage in our Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO medical plan in the next calendar year.An excellent retirement savings plan with a high employer contributionTuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program, and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor’s degree.A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries worldwide and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as the best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.

The Opportunity

This position works out of our Plano, TX location in the Neuromodulation Division. Our Neuromodulation business includes implantable devices compatible with mobile technology to help people who suffer from chronic pain and movement disorders. These non-opioid therapies allow us to provide interventional pain therapy to patients throughout the pain continuum.

It sounds like science fiction: sending small electrical pulses to the spine to block pain signals or to the brain to suppress tremor. As an R&D Engineer at Abbott Neuromodulation, you will have the opportunity to develop technology platforms that improve the lives of those suffering from chronic pain and movement disorders.

Each employee can make a difference at Abbott and has the power, either individually or as a team, to influence the success of the company. We are team-oriented, patient-focused, and progressive. We value people with great ideas who partner with others both internally and externally to take action and accomplish goals.

What You’ll Work On

Researches, develops, designs, and evaluates mechanical and electro-mechanical materials, components, assemblies, processes and/or equipmentConceptualizes new sub-assemblies using material knowledge and innovative mechanical designDevelops new products from initial design to market release with cross-functional partnersCreates and submits novel design solutions that expand the intellectual property of the businessConducts feasibility studies to verify capability and functionalityBalances design for reliability, manufacturing, and cost efficiencyMaintains detailed documentation throughout all phases of research and developmentPrepares technical reports, analyses, recommendations, and presentations reflecting the status and results of projects in progressParticipates/contributes to technical reviews of mechanical designsReviews and coordinates vendor activities to support developmentEstablishes and cultivates an extensive network of support to facilitate completion of assignmentsExercises judgment in selecting innovative, practical methods to achieve problem resolutionExhibits and instills decision-making based in objective engineering principles (analytical and empirical)Develops test methods, models, and fixtures to evaluate designsPlans, coordinates, and executes mechanical design verification activities for new productsMulti-tasks, prioritizes, and meets deadlines in a timely mannerIdentifies, communicates, and mitigates project risksBuilds and maintains positive and cooperative relationships internally and externallyEnsures compliance to all applicable internal requirements and external regulationsPosition may require up to 10% travel

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or related technical discipline2-5 years of relevant product development or R&D work experience (preferably with implantable hardware)Experience with CAD and FEA modeling software (SolidWorks, ANSYS preferred)Product development experience within a regulated environment (e.g. medical, aerospace, automotive, etc.)Experience working with cross-functional teams and taking initiative to ensure successful outcomesExcellent oral and written communication skills

Preferred Qualifications

Advanced degree in Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or related technical disciplineDemonstrated hands-on experience designing for manufacturing processes used in medical devices (e.g. biocompatible material selection, injection molding, machining, printed circuit board fabrication, extrusion, etc.)Strong history of cross-functional collaboration with other engineering disciplines (Electrical, Manufacturing)Experience with statistical techniques (e.g. DOE, hypothesis testing, etc.)Knowledge of design controls and regulations for medical device development

Apply Now

Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: www.abbottbenefits.com

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.

Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott, and on Twitter @AbbottNews.

The base pay for this position is $57,300.00 – $114,700.00. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

Title: QA Specialist
Description:
Job Title: QA Specialist

Supervisor: QA Manager

Department: Research & Development

Salary Range: $59k to $65k base salary, based on qualifications and experience (Plus additional targeted bonus)

Location: Remote - Preferred States: Arizona, Arkansas, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New Mexico, North Carolina, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Washington, West Virginia, and Wisconsin.

Job Summary:

The Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist will perform testing of web-based software and reports to certify quality, accuracy, and adherence to customer needs. This role requires an individual that can take guidance but has the confidence to be an independent thinker and takes ownership of the role.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:

 Inspect and analyze new components and data used in complex enterprise-level information systems. Ensure quality issues are identified and resolved. Record results of testing artifacts and procedures by maintaining proper documentation and reports. Use existing methods and procedures for inspection, testing, and sampling. Execute existing QA Automation scripts using Visual Studio, C#, and Selenium. Use a Test Case Management System Stay current on new technologies, participate in webinars, presentations, roadmap conversions and other product and solution related talks to stay on top of the latest and future technology. Participate in System Design and Enhancement meetings. Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Job Requirements: 

 2 or more years’ experience using the following systems: Microsoft Windows 10 Web Browsers (Chrome, Edge, Safari, Firefox, etc.) Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) TraceGains product knowledge is highly preferred, but not required Basic understanding of web-based solutions. Advanced troubleshooting skills. Strong time management and prioritization capabilities. Understanding of Quality Assurance practices and procedures. Excellent written and verbal skills are a MUST. Food & Beverage and Supplements industry experience a plus, but not required Ability to be a positive team player, willing to grow and change Occasional travel required for department meetings, all company events, in-person seminars/networking events, etc. Successful completion of a background screening process including, but not limited to, employment verifications, criminal search, OFAC, SSN Verification, as well as credit screening, where applicable and in accordance with federal and local regulations

Description:

Our success comes from finding, retaining, and supporting the highest quality talent by offering:

Day 1 Benefits Coverage with low cost Medical, Vision, DentalDay 1 Paid-time Off and Vacation4.5% Company Match 401(k) plan$500 Annual Company-paid Lifestyle BenefitCompetitive Compensation and BonusesCompany-paid Life and Disability InsuranceEmployee Stock Purchase PlanTraining and Advancement Opportunities

Why This Job
CMC provides an excellent opportunity to learn the steel, construction reinforcement and ground stabilization industries and to grow in your career. Whether you will spend your day brainstorming in an office cubicle, operating a crane, running manufacturing equipment or troubleshooting technical obstacles, at CMC, you’ll get the training and support from your team that you need to excel in your role and reach your full potential.

What You'll Do

Maintains work area and equipment in a clean orderly condition and follows safety regulationsOperates production equipment in accordance with established procedures and guidelinesParticipates in the CMC Safety Programs and proactively upholds the CMC Safety CultureAny other tasks as assigned by supervisor

What You'll Need

Ability to lift up to 50 lbsAbility to work in all weather conditionsExperience with metal sorting a plus but not required; to include the ability to distinguish between different metals and/or other materials for grading purposes and recognizing safety hazardsMust be able to frequently lift 25 lbs or more to include carrying or pushing objects up to 100ftMust be able to perform the physical task of the job assigned; to include climbing, bending, stooping, kneeling, and crouchingMust be able to stand for significant lengths of time in an industrial environment with exposure to all elements of weather

Your Education

High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent experience preferred

We are Commercial Metals Company, a Fortune 500 company with a family feel that’s already part of your life. Our steel products have been supporting structures in more than 20 countries for over 100 years. And the secret to our success? We’ve built our legacy by assembling a team of innovators and doers to tackle some of the most challenging problems facing our world over the last 100 years — but we’re just getting started.

If you’re ready to reimagine ways to make the steel industry more sustainable, reinforce the bridges and roadways connecting our communities, and do meaningful work, you’re ready to join CMC. Apply today and start moving your career — and our world — forward.

CMC is committed to providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, citizenship, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, or other status protected by federal, state or local law.
Company Description:
At CMC, we firmly believe that our people are the key to our success. Our energetic and entrepreneurial spirit has enabled us to remain a leader in the metals industry for more than 100 years, and we believe our success is a direct result of the contributions and work ethic of the most talented work force in the industry.

We have a commitment to our employees, and take pride in recruiting and developing the best talent. As a CMC employee, we provide you the support you need to grow in your career, and ensure that you are equipped with the knowledge and skills needed to do your job the right way - correctly, consistently and safely – every day. The safety and well-being of our employees is our number one priority.

Learn more today, and discover how you can take the next step in your career with the CMC family.
Specialties: Metals,Recycling,Fabrication,Distribution

Title: Senior Associate Supply Chain Specialist
Description:
Make an impact with NTT DATA

Join a company that is pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We are renowned for our technical excellence and leading innovations, and for making a difference to our clients and society. Our workplace embraces diversity and inclusion – it’s a place where you can grow, belong and thrive.

Your day at NTT DATA

The Senior Associate Analytics and Supply Chain Specialist provides support to the NTT Global Data Center Americas Supply Chain Team, a program focused Construction Procurement and Supplier Management Organization. The scope of the team is inclusive of Owner-Furnished, Contractor-Installed (“OFCI”) electrical and mechanical equipment, General Contractor, Architect & Engineering, Commissioning Agent, Building Monitoring Systems Contractor, and Specialty Consultant Services. The primary objective of this role is to enable supply chain solutions and its optimization, processes, and use of resources.

The successful candidate for this role is a data steward who excels in analyzing data to drive informed decision making, creating insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and integrity. They should also be proficient in data visualization, predictive analysis, and effectively communicating findings to tell a story in retrospect and provide future use applications.

What You'll Be Doing

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop and maintain pricing databases and benchmark data. Implement models to efficiently analyze data and forecast future costs. Perform global and regional supplier volume discount / rebate calculations after ensuring accurate basis of application. Facilitate Requests for Proposal (RFP) and Requests for Quotation (RFQ) processes. Conduct proposal and quotation commercial analysis in response to RFPs and RFQs, document results, and state conclusions. Identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities to drive department efficiencies. Develop and/or collect Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) to create presentation content for Supplier Business Reviews (SBR’s). Establish and/or maintain PowerBI dashboards, templates, and other tools to improve automation. Enter Purchase Order numbers into NTT GDCA Supply Chain PowerBI OFCI Tracker and review for supplier information accuracy. Administer the Supply Chain Operations SharePoint by adding users, maintaining permissions, auditing timely upload of Supplier submittals, etc. Create and route OFCI change orders and update log. Resolve OFCI invoice inquiries. Provide support with availability of the necessary resources to enable the Supply Chain team to execute everyday activities. Support strategic projects including but not limited to those that identify supply chain risk. 

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Impeccable attention to detail and production of timely high-quality work. Excellent project management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously and drive data driven results in a fast-paced environment. Organized, analytical, and structured with excellent communication, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills. Strong capability and expertise in MS Office Suites, preferably in Excel and PowerPoint, PowerBI and SharePoint. Visio and/or process mapping skills are desired. Works well in a team environment and independently, gives and receives clear expectations well. Recognizes information patterns and trends. Is analytically orientated, seeks to understand the how and the why, and strives for continuous improvement. Professionally summarizes analysis, to effectively communicate its meaning, tailored to various audiences. 

#GlobalDataCentersCareers

Education & Experience

College degree in Supply Chain, Analytics, Business, IT and/or professional certifications. 2-5 years of experience within a supply chain and/or analytics environment, preferably in the construction, mission critical, data center, semi-conductor, IT or similar sectors. 

Physical Requirements

Use of sight, hearing, and voice as well as motor skills. Able to hear and speak on a telephone. Close visual work on a computer. Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments. Familiarity with construction sites and factory hazards and ability to navigate project sites safely. 

Work Conditions & Other Requirements

This position is remote supporting the U.S. with occasional need to be onsite in either a shared workspace or construction jobsite. Extensive daily usage of workstation or computer. 

This is a remote position that requires reliable internet connection and electricity. A monthly stipend is provided to cover expenses associated with working remotely and use of a personal mobile device, if applicable.

NTT Global Data Centers Americas, Inc. offers competitive compensation based on experience, education, and location. Base salary for this position is $ 96,000 - $ 137,500.

All regular full-time employees are eligible for an annual bonus; payout is dependent upon individual and company performance.

Employees receive paid time-off, medical, dental, and vision benefits, life and supplemental insurance, short-term and long-term disability, flexible spending account, and 401k retirement plan to create a rich Total Rewards package.

Workplace type: 

Remote Working

About NTT DATA

NTT DATA is a $30+ billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long-term success. We invest over $3.6 billion each year in R&D to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure, and connectivity. We are also one of the leading providers of digital and AI infrastructure in the world. NTT DATA is part of NTT Group and headquartered in Tokyo.

Equal Opportunity Employer

NTT DATA is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, colour, gender, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, disability, pregnancy, marital status, veteran status, or any other protected category. Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.
Primary Description: NTT Global Data Centers · United States (Remote)
Company Description:
Global Data Centers is becoming a division of NTT DATA. Our global platform is one of the largest in the world, spanning more than 20 countries and regions, including the Americas, Asia Pacific, EMEA and India. NTT is routinely recognized as a Leader by leading networking and data center analysts. 

As a neutral operator, we offer access to multiple cloud providers, a large variety of internet exchanges and telecommunication network providers including our own IPv6-compliant Tier 1 Global IP Network. You benefit from tailored infrastructure, and experience consistent best practices in design and operations across all of our reliable, scalable and customizable data centers. We’re ready to facilitate client adoption of next-generation technologies for computing at scale, virtualization, data migration, and cloud and B2B private connectivity both regionally and across the globe.
Hiring Manager Subtitle: Corporate Recruiter at NTT Global Data Centers Americas- Connecting professionals with right opportunities!

Title: Manufacturing Engineer
Description:
Title: Manufacturing Engineer

Location: Rowlett, TX (on-site)

Salary: $80,000-$110,000 (DOE) with full benefits

Position Overview

The Manufacturing Engineer will be responsible for improving manufacturing processes to enhance efficiency, quality, and safety in production. This role involves analyzing current production methods, implementing best practices, and driving continuous improvement initiatives to optimize workflow and reduce waste.

What You Will Be Doing

Analyze and improve manufacturing processes to enhance efficiency and quality.Implement Lean and Six Sigma methodologies for process improvement.Conduct root cause analysis to identify and solve production issues.Design and optimize workflows and layouts to maximize productivity.Develop and maintain CAD models and documentation using SolidWorks.Facilitate training programs for staff on Continuous Improvement and 5S methodologies.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment on production goals and quality standards.

You Should Know Most Of The Following

Proven experience in manufacturing engineering or process improvement roles.Strong knowledge of Lean and Six Sigma principles.Proficiency in CAD software, particularly SolidWorks.Experience with Continuous Improvement methodologies.

Benefits

Title: Director, Global Product Management Communications
Description:
The Director of Global Product Management Communications will support designated Operating Committee member in the creation and implementation of critical communications that support change management and the ongoing growth of our business.

What you’ll do:

Partner with an Operating Committee (OC) Member to develop and execute a communications strategy and calendar that supports OC/BU objectives. Includes (but is not limited to): Town Halls, OC scripts, videos, presentations, announcements, posts, etc. Collaborate with other Communications Partners to drive alignment of communications activities across relevant teams, leveraging our intranet and other communications platforms. Collaborate across the OC, BU leaders, CCOE and others to thread key messages in scripts, provide feedback and contribute as appropriate. Collaborate with leaders and business partners to continuously improve live event viewership in key global locations. Support your OC members in elevating leadership capability on their teams through communications (as appropriate). Support your OC members in leading change and driving associate engagement. Help codify a set of proven practices for Communications. Drive continuous improvement and innovation across everything you do

What you’ll need:

7-10 years’ communications experience in a corporate environment. Undergraduate / Master’s degree in communications is a plus. Strong writing and editing skills. Excellent problem-solving skills. Proven ability to lead and motivate in a matrixed environment. Strong ability to listen, absorb, process and distill new information across a wide range of complex topics, programs, products and services. Strong ability to build trusted relationships at the executive level and to collaborate with partners at all levels of the organization. Ability to manage and be discreet with sensitive / confidential information

Additional requirements:

Creative thinker with service mindset. Outstanding interpersonal skills, integrity, credibility and confidence. Collaborative, team player. 

What We Offer:

In addition to an outstanding work environment with rapid advancing potential, Gartner associates enjoys exceptional compensation and benefits including:An upbeat, positive culture. Integrity, objectivity, collaboration, results and a no-limits mindset are central to our values. Limitless growth. We work with you to help you meet your goals and advance within the company. Encouragement to be innovative and challenge status quo. Exposure to industry leading training and development. Performance based recognition and rewards. 

Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

Gartner believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is 116,000 USD - 164,220 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based, uncapped sales incentive plan. Our talent acquisition team will provide the specific opportunity on our bonus or incentive programs to eligible candidates. We also offer market leading benefit programs including generous PTO, a 401k match up to $7,200 per year, the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount, and more.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

We deliver actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization's mission-critical priorities. 

Our unrivaled combination of expert-led, practitioner-sourced and data-driven research steers clients toward the right decisions on the issues that matter most. As a $5.9 billion company, with 20,000 associates, and a member of the S&P 500, we are an objective partner with about 15,000 client enterprises in more than 90 countries and territories — across all major functions, in every industry and enterprise size — and boast 40+ years of experience providing insights and expert guidance to client enterprises worldwide.

Title: Territory Sales Manager
Description:
Come join the Pack!
ABOUT THE ORGANIZATIONKIOTI Tractor is the U.S. subsidiary of Daedong Corporation specializing in the distribution of high quality tractors, UTVs, zero turn mowers, attachments and implements. Since its establishment in 1993, KIOTI has experienced rapid growth as a result of its unique ability to facilitate responsive engineering and production of KIOTI products specifically designed to meet the growing needs of North American equipment users.
Today, KIOTI Tractor sells its products through an expanding KIOTI dealer network of more than 500 dealerships located throughout North America. To assist with this, we have a strategically positioned U.S. warehouse distribution system and its streamlined parts, service and fulfillment center located in Wendell, North Carolina.
This is a remote position with required travel up to 90% in the assigned territory. The ideal candidate will be currently located within the listed territory - Florida, South Carolina, or Georgia.
JOB SUMMARYKIOTI Tractor, a leader in the design and manufacture of compact tractors, utility vehicles, turf care, and compact construction equipment, is seeking a Territory Sales Manager to join our team. The Territory Sales Manager is responsible for promoting and selling the KIOTI Equipment line through our dedicated dealer organization. This position covers the territory of Georgia, Florida, South Carolina.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF JOBManage dealer network in assigned territory by promoting growth with existing dealers, securing new dealers, and purging poor performing dealers Reach wholesale and retail projected performance goals Complete monthly and yearly sales forecasts by dealership by territory Provide input on monthly, quarterly, and yearly sales programs Predict market trends and projections Ensure dealer inventory accuracy and perform physical inventories as required Manage budget and submit weekly expense reports to Regional Sales Manager including, weekly field trip reports Manage demonstration equipment accounts Assist with credit collections as required Report competitive information and programs to KIOTI Management Assist with national and regional trade shows as required Other reports upon management request
EDUCATIONAL AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTSHigh school diploma required Bachelor's degree in business or related field is preferred 3+ years of experience in similar industry Must be willing to travel as a road warrior up to 90% 0-3 years of related database administration experience Knowledge and experience in Microsoft Office is preferred
KIOTI BENEFITS4% 401k employer match, all contributions immediately vestedBirthday PTOFree Medical Insurance (for employee only)Vision, dental, and life insurance availableWellness reimbursementsKIOTI Café - free for all employees!Training/Growth Opportunities
Daedong-USA, Inc. dba KIOTI Tractor provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
Company Description: KIOTI Tractor - Daedong-USA, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of Daedong Industrial Co., Ltd. specializing in the manufacturing and distribution of high quality tractors, UTVs, zero turn mowers, attachments, and implements. Since its establishment in 1993, Daedong-USA has experienced rapid growth as a result of its unique ability to facilitate the responsive engineering and production of KIOTI products specifically designed to meet the growing needs of North American equipment users. Today, Daedong-USA distributes KIOTI products through an expanding KIOTI dealer network of more than 450 dealers, a strategically positioned U.S. warehouse distribution system, and its streamlined parts, service, and fulfillment center located in Wendell, North Carolina.
Specialties: Machinery,Compact Tractors,Utility Tractors,Utility Vehicles,Tractor Implements

Title: Prompt Engineering Training and Internship Program
Description:
Prompt Engineering Training & Internship Program (M/F)Location: RemoteProgram Type: Training with Practical InternshipDuration: 3 monthsCompensation: UnpaidLearn More: https://www.refontelearning.com/
Program Overview:Are you excited about the potential of AI language models and eager to develop expertise in optimizing them? The Prompt Engineering Training and Internship Program offers a unique opportunity to gain specialized knowledge in creating and refining prompts for large language models (LLMs) like GPT-4, BERT, and T5. This program provides both theoretical learning and hands-on experience, enabling you to design, test, and enhance prompts to improve the accuracy and performance of AI models across a variety of use cases.
Program Goals:Master Prompt Engineering: Learn the fundamentals of crafting effective prompts for LLMs, optimizing them for specific tasks such as text generation, question answering, summarization, and translation.Deep Dive into Language Models: Gain a solid understanding of how LLMs function, including natural language processing (NLP) techniques, transfer learning, and contextual embeddings.Hands-On Prompt Development: Work with cutting-edge tools to create, test, and optimize prompts. Learn how to troubleshoot and iterate on prompts to improve AI model outputs and overall performance.Experimentation & Testing: Learn how to experiment with different prompt structures, analyze model outputs, and refine prompts based on performance metrics to enhance AI accuracy.Real-World Internship Experience: Apply your skills in prompt engineering on real-world business applications. Work alongside AI experts to optimize and enhance AI-driven solutions, helping businesses leverage AI tools more effectively.
Skills You Will Gain:Expertise in prompt design for tasks like content generation, code generation, and data extraction using AI models.In-depth knowledge of large language models (LLMs) such as GPT, BERT, and T5, and how to leverage them for practical AI applications.Hands-on experience with prompt testing, optimization, and troubleshooting to improve AI model output and performance.Understanding of NLP techniques such as tokenization, semantic analysis, and text classification to enhance prompt effectiveness.Experience using AI platforms like OpenAI's GPT models, Hugging Face, and other AI tools to integrate models into real-world applications.Familiarity with APIs and AI model integration for building AI-powered applications.Team collaboration skills working in cross-functional teams, applying agile methodologies to continuously improve AI models and workflows.
Who Should Apply?Students or recent graduates passionate about AI, natural language processing (NLP), and machine learning.Tech professionals with a background in computer science, data science, or software development who are looking to specialize in AI-powered applications or conversational AI.Individuals with a passion for language, creativity, and solving problems using advanced AI technologies.
Why Join This Program?Hands-On Experience: Work directly with advanced language models and gain practical experience in prompt engineering to tackle real-world business challenges.Emerging Skillset: Gain proficiency in prompt engineering, an in-demand skill in the rapidly growing AI and machine learning fields.Career Opportunities: With the increasing reliance on AI-powered tools for content generation, customer service, and automation, there is a growing demand for Prompt Engineers. Completing this program will equip you with the skills to pursue careers as a Prompt Engineer, NLP Specialist, AI Developer, or Conversational AI Expert.Expert Guidance: Benefit from mentorship by experienced AI professionals who will help you refine your skills and stay up-to-date with the latest developments in AI and language models.
Apply NowTake the next step in your career by mastering the art of Prompt Engineering. Learn how to optimize AI language models and become an expert in leveraging AI to transform how machines interact with and understand human language.
Learn More: https://www.refontelearning.com/
Company Description:
Unlock your potential in the digital realm with Refonte Learning! We are an Ed-Tech powerhouse under Refonte Private Limited, offering comprehensive IT training programs. Develop vital competencies like Python, SQL, Tableau, and Advanced Excel through our engaging, hands-on approach. Invest in yourself and thrive in the digital age.

The unique Global Training & Internship Program combines industry-relevant training with real-world project work alongside experienced professionals. Gain hands-on experience and international exposure, preparing you for a successful career in IT and digital marketing. Refonte Learning also provides top-notch digital marketing services, helping businesses grow their reach through tailored solutions exceeding expectations.

At Refonte Learning, you'll gain the knowledge and practical skills you need to succeed in the digital world, all under the guidance of experienced professionals and industry leaders. Our flexible learning options and focus on real-world application through projects and internships ensure you can tailor your education to your specific goals and career aspirations, while simultaneously gaining valuable international exposure through our OGTIP program.

Ready to take your career to the next level?

Visit our website or contact us today to discover how Refonte Learning can empower your career journey and equip you with the skills and experience you need to achieve your goals.

Title: Cement Plant Maintenance Technician | Midlothian, TX (various shifts)
Description:
Description

A member of the S&P 500 Index, Martin Marietta is an American-based company and a leading supplier of heavy building materials – including aggregates, cement, ready-mixed concrete and asphalt. Through a network of operations spanning 28 states, Canada and the Bahamas, dedicated Martin Marietta teams supply the foundational resources upon which our communities thrive. Martin Marietta's Magnesia Specialties business produces high-purity magnesia and dolomitic lime products used worldwide in environmental, industrial, agricultural and specialty applications.

At Martin Marietta, we strive to work with the best and the brightest – those who have the potential to become our company's future leaders. Each of our roughly 9,500 people shares a common purpose regardless of their professional role or work environment. Together, we utilize our diverse skills and experiences to drive our company and its extraordinary culture forward. Our aim is to build on our foundation of success and help values-driven and hardworking people realize their full potential. When you decide to invest your career in Martin Marietta, you'll know what it's like to be respected, challenged and rewarded.

To learn more about Martin Marietta and our ONE team, visit careersthatcrush.com.

Are you ready to start a new career with a LEADER in the industry and WORLD CLASS team!

What We Offer

Competitive hourly pay with OT opportunities Annual Pay IncreasesPTO Available as of DAY ONEOpportunities to grow with companyGuaranteed to be home every day401(k) plan with company matchEmployee Pension plan (at no cost to employees)Full Medical, Health & Wellness Benefits start on FIRST DAY

The Process Maintenance Technician reports to the Shift Supervisor and will work on rotating shifts. This person is expected to work with little or no supervision while performing maintenance on equipment necessary for the manufacturing of cement. Shift (A and C Crew)

Essential Functions

Inspect plant process machinery and provide recommendations for repairInstall & repair plant process machinery.Operate equipment such as boom lifts, cranes, forklifts, and other related mobile equipment

Preferred Education And Experience

High school diploma or equivalent.Prior experience in the maintenance of heavy process machinery, in the cement industry, is preferred.Ability to read, write and verbally communicate in the English language.Must be able to read & understand operations and maintenance manuals, drawings, and schematics.Must place their personal safety and others safety as no. 1 priority.Must be able to utilize various measuring devices (micrometers, square, level, etc.).Must be able to exhibit competence in shielded arc welding & flame cutting.Must be able to read gauges & keep accurate records of operating procedures and maintenance history.Pass required physical examination and drug screens.Preferred knowledge of all types of equipment used in the manufacturing of cement.Must have knowledge of pneumatic, hydraulic, electrical and mechanical systems.Ability to repair and rebuild plant equipment with little or no supervision.Knowledgeable of MSHA standards and requirements.Knowledge of hazards associated with areas of responsibility.

Physical Requirements

The Maintenance Technician must be able to work in all weather conditions including heat, cold, ice, rain and in high humidity. The technician will also be required to work in all plant environments and will be exposed to vibrating equipment and mechanical and electrical hazards. The technician must have the ability to sit, stand, stoop, and bend for extended periods of time (up to 12 hours).

In return, we offer a highly competitive benefits package, including:

 Medical Prescription Drug Dental Vision Health Care Reimbursement Account Dependent Care Reimbursement Account Wellness Programs Employee Assistance Plan Paid Holidays and Vacation 401(k) with Company matching Pension Salary Continuation – Short-Term Disability Long-Term Disability Options Employee Life Insurance Spouse & Dependent Life Insurance Business Travel Accident Insurance Direct Deposit Payroll Educational/Tuition Assistance Plan College Scholarship Program – for dependent children Matching Gift Program New Auto Purchase Discount Plans

At Martin Marietta, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and commit that qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Company Description:
A member of the S&P 500 Index and a leading supplier of building materials, Martin Marietta employs more than 9,300 people across 28 states, Canada and the Bahamas. Our aggregates, cement, ready-mixed concrete and asphalt products are the foundational materials on which our communities thrive and grow. Martin Marietta’s Magnesia Specialties business produces high-purity magnesia and dolomitic lime products used worldwide in environmental, industrial, agricultural and specialty applications.

Every member of our ONE Martin Marietta team is driven by our shared values of Safety, Integrity, Excellence, Community and Stewardship. We provide exceptional customer service and strive to be good neighbors in the 500 communities in which we operate. We also support each other and work to build a legacy our loved ones will be proud of. We know that together, we’ll make an impact that lasts far beyond tomorrow.
Specialties: Aggregates,Cement,Ready Mix Concrete,Asphalt,Magnesium Hydroxide,Magnesium Oxide,Dolomitic Lime

Title: Supply Chain Services Inventory Control Lead
Description:
Job Summary

The Supply Chain Management Inventory Control Lead performs key roles in the Supply Chain Management General Stores department. This person maintains responsibility for ensuring consistent and accurate control of perpetual inventory supplies, par management, and efficient delivery to the facility departments.

Essential Functions Of The Role

Oversees all incoming shipments of Perpetual Inventory supplies for accurate application to General Stores inventory. Ensures consistent and timely delivery of products to department par areas.Confirms and validates condition of products, catalog numbers, quantities, descriptions, expiration dates, and sizes of items.Enters appropriate information accurately in the Lawson System. Processes and resolves all necessary Lawson inventory control reports.Performs accurate Quantity-on-Hand quality control steps to ensure inventory accuracy in General Stores.Performs leadership role in cycle count procedures.Maintains orderly and organized work area to facilitate efficient processes and staff cross-training opportunities.Communicates via Lawson System, Outlook email, etc. as delegated by facility SCM Director.Engages in problem-solving processes to ensure accuracy of supply issues and returns.Oversees accurate filing and tracking systems documenting supply distribution tracking for volumes and trends.Performs SCM inventory tech duties efficiently as assigned.Ensures accurate tracking of supply data such as back orders, manufacturer numbers, expiration dates, product recalls, lot numbers, etc. as needed.

KEY SUCCESS FACTORS

2 years of college education preferred.

Benefits

Our competitive benefits package includes the following:

Immediate eligibility for health and welfare benefits401(k) savings plan with dollar-for-dollar match up to 5%Tuition ReimbursementPTO accrual beginning Day 1

Note: Benefits may vary based on position type and/or level

Qualifications

EDUCATION - H.S. Diploma/GED EquivalentEXPERIENCE - 1 Year of Experience

With us by your side, there's no stopping you. It's why we're creating a new kind of healthcare at Baylor Scott & White. And we're just getting started.

Title: Remote Contact Center Quality Assurance Specialist
Description:
Job Details

Description

The 700 Club Prayer Center

The Christian Broadcasting Network (CBN) is looking for a Quality Assurance Specialist to be accountable for analysis of customer conversations/interactions utilizing an advanced speech analytics solution. Responsibilities include understanding the organization’s business objectives and goals, analyzing recorded audio and audio-based data sets for critical insights, patterns, and trends as well as communicating analysis and proposing solutions to the organization.

This role will collaborate with operations and staff management using data and speech analytics to interpret and drive effective execution of various department initiatives. This position will help determine how to improve call performance metrics, increase customer satisfaction with daily prayer and product interactions, and to provide excellent execution of contact center programs. This will include phone interactions, email, social media, and others. Day-to-day responsibilities include: requirements gathering; definition, documentation, identification and creation of words and phrases that are used to drive business value utilizing the speech analytics solution; and, the creation of analytical reports designed to help the team achieve business goals.

Our QA Specialist is a highly disciplined self-starter with solid collaboration and communication skills who thrives on data, language, and technology. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, the ability to analyze root-cause, and a strong attention to detail.

The Successful Candidate Will Have The Following Qualifications

Ability to work from home with access to a high speed internet routerBusiness Analysis and/or Quality Analysis background desired (1-3 years total professional experience).  Knowledgeable in call center metrics Familiar with database query strings CallMiner Eureka speech analytics, SalesForce.com, SQL/SSRS a plus  Must be proficient in Microsoft Suite, specifically Excel; pivot tables, V-lookups, formulas and importing of data Individual must be a confident team player who can work well with others, mentor new team members and provide constructive feedbackExcellent communication skills and a positive attitude are required for daily interaction with data consumersDemonstrated ability to use various analytical tools and techniques to evaluate business problems and formulate solutionsAbility to engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously Flexibility and ability to adjust to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment is a mustBachelors degree desired. Prefer focus areas in Business, Analytics, Information Technology, Linguistics, English, or similarFluency in Spanish language a plus

CBN is a global nonprofit ministry demonstrating the love of God by sharing the Gospel through digital content, traditional media, and humanitarian aid. CBN offers a professional and rewarding work environment, competitive salary, and benefits package to include healthcare for full time positions. If you meet the listed qualifications and are in agreement with CBN’s mission and purpose, please click apply or visit our CBN Job Board at www.cbn.com for application and benefit information.

We are unable to give full consideration to resumes without applications.
Primary Description: The Christian Broadcasting Network · United States (Remote)
Company Description: CBN is a global nonprofit ministry demonstrating the love of God and sharing the Gospel of Jesus Christ through media evangelism and humanitarian aid.
Specialties: Television,Christian ministry,global humanitarian relief

Title: Food Safety & Quality Training Manager
Description:
Since 1869 we've connected people through food they love. We’re proud to be stewards of amazing brands that people trust. Our portfolio includes the iconic Campbell’s brand, as well as Michael Angelo’s, noosa, Pace, Pacific Foods, Prego, Rao’s Homemade, Swanson, and V8. In our Snacks division, we have brands like Cape Cod, Goldfish, Kettle Brand, Lance, Late July, Pepperidge Farm, Snack Factory, and Snyder’s of Hanover. 

Here, you will make a difference every day. You will be supported to build a rewarding career with opportunities to grow, innovate and inspire. Make history with us.

Why Campbell’s…

Benefits begin on day one and include medical, dental, short and long-term disability, AD&D, and life insurance (for individual, families, and domestic partners).Employees are eligible for our matching 401(k) plan and can enroll on the first day of employment with immediate vesting.Campbell’s offers unlimited sick time along with paid time off and holiday pay.If in WHQ – free access to the fitness center. Access to on-site day care (operated by Bright Horizons) and company store.Giving back to the communities where our employees work and live is very important to Campbell’s. Our “Campbell’s Cares” program matches employee donations and/or volunteer activity up to $1,500 annually.Campbell’s has a variety of Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to support employees.

How You Will Make History Here…

This is a highly visible role within the food safety and quality leadership team. It’s an opportunity for a motivated person to take an existing system to the next level.

What You Will Do…

This position is responsible for the development of the Food Safety & Quality (FSQ) training strategy and facilitation of FSQ training. The role acts as the Subject Matter Expert for FSQ training.

Responsibilities include Setting the Standard to elevate the FSQ training program to the next level. This includes executing and continuously improving the FSQ Training & Development strategy. Additionally, the role is responsible for the development and delivery of Enterprise training modules, facilitation of internal and external training, and the management of Food Safety and Quality Alchemy training. Individual requires quality systems knowledge, ideally with plant experience. Knowledge of regulatory, customer, certifying bodies and Campbell requirements will be used to perform a variety of duties including execution of processes & protocols for training.

The position will elevate the current training program, centralize, and standardize training content, and integrate the program into the electronic Quality Management System and Campbell’s Connected Factory initiative. Additionally, the position is responsible for establishing, executing, and continuously improving an FSQ competency development program. The employee will support the optimization of manufacturing Food Safety & Quality job specific training and its integration into an electronic plant floor system. The position will have a strong grasp of the principles of Statistical Process Control (SPC) and the ability to train and support FSQ teams in the application of these principles. The employee will also be responsible for the management and continuous improvement of the Food Safety & Quality onboarding program. Employee must be able to plan and prioritize work effectively and independently. This position requires proficiency in communication, training, strategic thinking, and continuous improvement techniques.

Principal Responsibilities

10% of time – Lead strategic planning for Food Safety & Quality training program.10% of time – Training partner with HR Business Partner on new training models / Connected Factory10% of time – Lead Food Safety & Quality onboarding across the network10% of time – Track and trend FSQ training performance indicators, action against underperforming indicators10% of time – Initiate continuous improvement and standardization of Food Safety & Quality training program.20% of time – Develop training content and/or content identification through external partners.30% of time – Execute training content, including support of SPC initiatives.

Job Complexity

Collaborate with key Food Safety & Quality functions to develop FSQ training strategy and content that aligns risk, priority, and scope.Must be able to effectively plan, communicate and execute training plan within its defined scope, including scheduling resources (internal and external) and conducting necessary meetings.Identify appropriate performance indicators for FSQ training. Track and trend FSQ performance indicators, and action against under-performing indicators to drive continuous improvement.Select appropriate quality and training tools and techniques and use them in a variety of practical applications.Work with functional and cross-functional partners, including technical subject matter experts, to identify training opportunities and action to address opportunities.Train in a professional, ethical, and objective manner using and interpreting applicable standards or requirements, with an awareness of legal and financial ramifications.Support HR Business Partners with new training tools and training initiatives related to Campbell’s Connected Factory as it relates to Food Safety & QualityDefine Food Safety & Quality onboarding process for new hires and provide training and mentoring as needed.Maintain knowledge of industry leading best practices and current domestic and international regulations for integration into Food Safety & Quality training programEstablish, execute, and continuously improve Campbell’s Food Safety & Quality competency development program.Train Food Safety & Quality network on Statistical Process Control principles and tools. Support project teams as needed.Manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize based on business needs.Use strategic thinking and identify best practices to elevate FSQ training and development program to best in class.

What You Bring To The Table…

Required Education: Bachelor’s degreePreferred Education: Bachelor’s degree in Food Science or Science in technical field7+ years in Quality SystemsFood manufacturing experience

It would be great if you have…

Working knowledge of FDA/USDA regulations with emphasis on FSMA requirementsTechnical competency in Statistical Process Control principles and their applicationExperience in development, management, and facilitation of a Food Safety & Quality training programAbility to function as liaison with external agencies as it relates to training and development.Excellent communication skills with an ability to prepare in-depth training materials, interpret and communicate complex information.Highly self-motivated, ability to multi-task and set priorities.Adapts quickly and easily to change to both internal and external factors.Experience with adult learning styles, a plusProficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Working Conditions

Office environment with estimated 30% travel to domestic plant locationsCulture of teamwork, collaboration, positivity, and support

Compensation And Benefits

The target base salary range for this full-time, salaried position is between

$105,300-$151,300

Individual base pay depends on work location and additional factors such as experience, job-related skills, and relevant education or training. Total pay may include other forms of compensation. In addition, we offer competitive health, dental, 401k and wellness benefits beginning on the first day of employment. Please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner for more information about our total rewards package.

The Company is committed to providing equal opportunity for employees and qualified applicants in all aspects of the employment relationship, including consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, marital status, protected veteran status, disability, age, religion, or any other classification protected by law.
Company Description:
Since 1869, we’ve been connecting people through food they love. Our history was created by remarkable people, ideas and innovations.

We are stewards of amazing brands. We have a focused strategy and leading brands in our two divisions: Meals & Beverages and Snacks. We foster a culture of belonging where people come first. We live our values, always, and show great care for the communities we call home. We are passionate and relentless in our pursuit of winning with character, while setting the highest standards for performance.
Specialties: Consumer Packaged Goods,Food & Beverage,CPG,Food Production,Foodservice,Snacks

Title: Manufacturing Engineer
Description:
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Engineering discipline2+ years of professional experienceMBOM structure & creation experienceExperience with Manufacturing / Assembly / Production processesProficient in MS Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint etc.)Experience with CAD

Job Code/Title

E1622:Manufacturing Engineer

Job Description

You will be the Manufacturing Engineer for the PAC-3 Command Launch System (CLS) Program Manufacturing Engineering team. Our team supports all aspects of manufacturing and assembly of the PAC-3 CLS through make sites and external suppliers. This work is essential for the program to execute current contract requirement as well as capture future business for the program. The position will serve as a Manufacturing Engineering point of contact to the other functions. Frequent communication and collaboration with other disciplines including Design Engineering, Production Operations, Quality Engineering, Global Supply Chain, Finance, Production Planning and Control, Contracts, Master Planning, and Program Management are required. Experience building positive relationships, communicating across functional and physical boundaries, managing cost, schedule, quality, and safety is critical for the role.

What You Will Be Doing:

 Working in MPMLink Windchill on Change Notices that generate Change Task (CT)s and create/update MBOMs and effectivities. Working with the Production Planning and Control (PP&C) group, shop manufacturing engineers from different Lockheed sites, and engineering. Work on PAC-3 program tooling. Ability to obtain Security Clearance.

This position typically requires 2 years of professional experience.

Why Join Us

Do you want to be part of a company culture that empowers employees to think big, lead with a growth mindset, and make the impossible a reality? We provide the resources and give you the flexibility to enable inspiration and focus -if you have the passion and courage to dream big, work hard, and have fun doing what you love then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

From onsite to remote, we offer flexible work schedules to comprehensive benefits investing in your future and security, Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package here.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We Hear You, We See You. At Lockheed Martin, we invest in people and promote the sharing of ideas to create incredible solutions. We know that our success depends on the combined efforts of diverse thinkers like you! At Lockheed Martin, we cultivate an inclusive environment that appreciates differences and unique thinking.

Our global commitment to diversity and inclusion reflects our values of doing what's right, respecting others, and performing with excellence. Learn more here: Global Diversity & Inclusion.

This position is located in Arlington, TX. Discover Arlington.

MUST BE A U.S. CITIZEN - The selected candidate must be able to obtain a secret clearance.

Experience in design for manufacturing

Knowledge of Lean manufacturing principlesProcess improvement experienceGD&T experienceTooling experienceSelf-motivated, performs work with the general direction

Title: Injection Molding Operator $20.00/hr + $1.00/hr Shift Differential 6:45AM-7PM
Description:
Molding Operator

$20.00/hr + $1.00/hr Shift Differential

6:45PM-7AM

Who we are looking for:

We are currently searching for an Injection Molding Operator to be based out of Dallas, TX. Reporting to the Molding Manager, this Molding Operator’s primary focus will be tending the machines, packaging parts, basic material handling, and accomplishing daily production goals.

What you’ll do:

Run various machines and equipment within the molding departmentProcess and complete paperwork, and operate a forklift as requiredProgress towards a Molding Technician, where you’ll oversee preventative maintenance on machines, manage changing out tools and molds, and train Injection Molding AssociatesFollow plant safety rules and wear proper PPE, which includes safety glasses, ear plugs, steel-toe boots/shoes, and glovesPerform Other Duties as Assigned.


What you'll bring:

Minimum educational requirement is high school diploma, or equivalentExperience reading and interpreting work ordersBasic math and counting skillsAbility to lift 50 pounds unassistedHave an attention to detail, accuracy, time management, and organizationAll associates must embrace and foster an environment that supports our core values of Integrity, Respect, Excellence, Teamwork and AccountabilityPrevious machine operating and forklift experience is a plus


As a Level 1, you’ll:

Verify quantities per box and per pallet, and ensure part numbers and labels are accurateConduct quality control specifications on finished product throughout the run, including inspecting products for surface and dimension defectsComplete quality control paperwork on finished productsTend to alarms and alert Technician or Operator 2/3 if neededPerform consistent checks on material systems to ensure their fully loadedPerform cleaning and inspection duties as required


As Level 2, you’ll:

Read and interpret works orders as they come throughLearn and complete purging duties on all machinesAnswer alarms on machines and perform corrective actionsRemove damaged or defective parts from the mold as required


As a Level 3, you’ll:

Set up, operate, and tend to all machinesPerform mold and resin changes for machines and setupsSet tool, tonnage, and injection molding parameters


Within 3 months, you’ll:

Complete hourly immersion and any required training.Have a good understanding of our Safety Culture.Have developed relationships with the key stakeholders for this role.Be well-versed in Atkore’s Business System and the importance of your role to daily operations.


Who we are:

Atkore is a four-time Great Place to Work© certification and a two-time Top Workplaces USA award winner! We’re committed to creating an engaged and aligned workforce that drives collaborative culture. Our team strives for breakthrough results, stays focused on being standout leaders, and fully supports decisions of the Company. We consistently live the Atkore mission, strategic priorities, and behaviors, all in a way that’s consistent with our core values.

Join our team and align yourself with an industry leader!
Company Description: Atkore is a leading manufacturer of electrical products for commercial, industrial, data center, telecommunications, and solar applications. With 5,600 employees and $3.5B in sales in fiscal year 2023, we deliver sustainable solutions to meet the growing demands of electrification and digital transformation.
Specialties: Manufacturing,Plastic Pipe and Tube,Metal Framing Channel,Strut,Conduit,armored cable,prefabrication

Title: Production Manager (Manufacturing)
Description:
Who is Mother Parkers?
We are one of the largest tea and coffee manufacturers in North America, with a mission to create a better beverage experience for our customers. As a leading customer solutions provider to some of North America’s largest retailers and foodservice chains, we use state-of-the-art technology and new product innovation to help our customers grow their business and deliver superior products to their clientele. Our team of coffee and tea experts are deeply passionate about what we do, proud of our 100+ years of business success, and excited about building a future with endless possibilities. Come join our team and work among the best, collaborate with high performers, and contribute to challenging work every day!
The Role:
We have an opportunity for an experienced Production Manager to join our Production team at our Fort Worth Plant. In this role you will be responsible for managing the plant operations and leading production through advanced manufacturing systems, processing, and quality &maintenance, to ensure that key accountabilities with the Operational Framework SQCDPE and associated Key Performance Indicators are met.
What you get to do:
Partner with EHSS to develop health and safety objectives and assign accordingly.Conduct safety inspections and ensure that the plant is in compliance.Monitor and sign off all accident investigations.Attend Ergonomics and Joint Health and Safety meetings.Ensure plant is in GMP & SQF compliance.Ensure facility is constantly prepared for regulatory, corporate and customer directed inspections.Develop and train Shift Supervisors to increase long term capability of the plant.Establish operational performance and optimum utilization of machines and equipment.Collaborate with facility team on production planning and control, materials processing and assembly, maintenance and other production specific activities.Communicate shift performances and address issues including but not limited to safety, quality, equipment efficiency, schedule adherence, personnel performance and material usage.Evaluate the efficiency of production operations to determine adequacy of personnel, equipment and production methods and technologies used.Review production and operating reports and resolves manufacturing inefficiencies to ensure minimum cost and prevent operational delays.Consult with other managers to set production KPI's and schedules as well as proactive and preventative maintenance.Preparing production reports and key performance indicatorsObserve, develop and revise operational changes to ensure compliance with standards.Recommend operational changes to senior management when necessary to ensure production KPI's are met and safety and quality standards maintained.Alignment of hourly production labor with budgetary and scheduling requirements.Support the development and Advancement of Safety, TPM and Quality culture.Ensure that KPIs are met for packaging and processing areas.Manage operational responsibilities for BBS, management and safety committee inspections as well as EHSS.
What you bring to the role:
Minimum 5-7 years of operations experience in leadership roles in consumer packaged goods and/or food manufacturing required.Technical knowledge of processing and packaging is an asset.Demonstrated track record of building and leading high functioning teams.Lean Six-Sigma experience highly desirable.Strong knowledge and experience in all of the following areas: Occupational Health & Safety, People Leadership, Lean Manufacturing, Quality Assurance .Ability to set direction through business acumen, strategic agility and dealing with ambiguity.Can inspire and influence by motivating others.Act with integrity and trust.Drive results with timely decision making, command and negotiating skills.Operate with a sense of urgency being action oriented and exhibiting perseverance.Strong project management and budgeting skills.Knowledge of operating systems CMMS, ERP and MES.Sound administrative skills, advanced skill level with current office and applications software packages such as Project, Word, and Excel.Excellent communication skills with fluency in English, both written and verbal.
What we offer you:
Competitive Total Rewards package – health benefits coverage on day 1, employer matched retirement savings plans, Flexible Spending Account.Employee discount program on our coffee and tea products.Annual Safety Shoes Program – your safety is our #1 priority.Tuition Assistance Program – we value continuous learning and self-development.

By providing your information to us, you understand and agree to Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee’s Privacy Policy: https://www.mother-parkers.com/privacy-policy/
While Mother Parkers welcomes all applications, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or search firms. Only those candidates who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted. Mother Parkers is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Primary Description: Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee · Fort Worth, TX (On-site)
Company Description: Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee is a leading customer solutions provider, manufacturing and supplying quality coffee and tea to some of North America’s largest retailers and foodservice chains. Our fast-growing EcoCup® brand of single-serve pods makes it easy for consumers to recycle through 3 easy steps of separation.  Combining state-of-the-art technology and new product innovation with more than 100 years of business success, Mother Parkers continues to grow. We take pride in delivering a better beverage experience for customers and consumers, and a better employment experience for our people! We operate multiple manufacturing facilities in both Canada and the U.S.
Specialties: Roasted Coffee & Dry Tea Packing

Title: Maintenance Supervisor
Description:
Job Description

Salad and Go is seeking a Maintenance Supervisor will help oversee all engineering maintenance work at the Food Production Facility. This position will lead a team of maintenance technicians in the day-to-day activities, will drive improvements in how maintenance engineering is performed at the site, and manage all aspects of the building facilities. They will coordinate closely with the leadership team at the site to ensure priorities are understood and the team performs at a high standard to minimize downtime, drive productivity and ensure a high standard of Safety and Quality. They will plan, coordinate, assign and manage the work of others.

Responsibilities

Title: Associate Production Specialist
Description:
Creative Design and Content Associate Production Specialist
Blizzard Entertainment’s Creative Design and Content team is seeking a highly motivated Associate Production Specialist to support Creative Marketing projects as they move from intake, through ideation, and creative development, to completion. You’ll help content development initiatives for Marketing, focused on owned and operated channels, social media, digital advertising for user acquisition, motion graphics, and video content. You’ll partner with various teams across Blizzard to ensure projects are within scope and approved assets are distributed on time. 
The ideal candidate will foster a welcoming and inclusive environment. You’ll support our internal teams and partners through our workflows, processes, and best practices, promoting productivity and efficiency across creative development. 
Responsibilities:LeadershipWork with an internal content creation team, including copywriters, designers, artists, and video editors, to deliver best-in-class marketing creative.Support project comms with meaningful and actionable results, mitigate risk, follow through on milestones and project statuses. Project ManagementDevelop and maintain project timelines, allocating resources, and balancing effort across teams effectively to meet deadlines.CollaborationSecure approval of creative concepts, ensuring stakeholder feedback is addressed and aligns with the marketing strategy. Resource OversightManage project effort, ensuring resources are allocated efficiently to balance existing, and upcoming projects in queue, across internal and external resources. Quality AssuranceMaintain high standards of creative excellence and quality control throughout the production process including ESRB Compliance. Stay informed on gaming industry trends, emerging tools, ESRB Compliance and 1st party platform updates. 
Requirements:A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a producer/project manager role in a creative environment – preferably advertising/design agency, game developer or entertainment studio.Experience using cloud based Project Management software.Knowledge of digital content creative development for 1st party platforms, static, video and motion graphics.Service-oriented attitude with the ability to develop, grow and maintain strong relationships with individuals, teams and departments.Strong critical thinking, written and verbal communication skills.Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously with varying degrees of complexity.A love of video games.Ability to act with discretion when handling confidential matters.Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, G-Suite as well as Adobe Acrobat.
Pluses:Active player of Blizzard Games Knowledge of multi-channel marketing creative developmentBasic knowledge of Adobe Creative SuiteEntertainment experience – preferably gaming
Required application materials: Resume
Company Description:
Activision Blizzard, Inc. is one of the world’s largest interactive entertainment companies, with operations across North America, Europe, and Asia. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, Skylanders®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™, and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!

We’re proud to be recognized as one of FORTUNE’s "100 Best Companies To Work For®” for four consecutive years and have earned a spot on FORTUNE’s “Most Admired Companies,” and “Future 50” lists. Our 10,000+ global employees are some of the best and brightest talents across entertainment, media, and technology.
